intro: Churumaya arborea, commonly known as the tree of life, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is typically a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. Churumaya arborea is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has cultural significance in some indigenous communities.
